universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Modify Layout.jsx: Change Bottom Nav background to 'bg-black'. Update icons to be 'text-gray-500' (inactive) and 'text-white' (active).
2. Modify Layout.jsx: Remove the Profile Link/Icon from the top Header.
3. Modify Layout.jsx: Refactor Sidebar (Hamburger Menu). Move the User Profile info to be immediately below the close button/logo, with minimal padding. Ensure no large white gaps.
4. Modify Dashboard.jsx: Redesign the Dump Yard widget. Make it look like a 'Critical Alert' card. Remove the list of health risks. Keep it concise: Status, Daily Waste, and a 'View Details' link.
5. Ensure all text contrast ratios meet accessibility standards (White text on Black bg is safe).
